Also, the other reviews mention the adjustable lumbar pad.  I can't imagine not being able to make this adjustment and recommend this less expensive option.

author: Erik L. Wolff
title: Best desk chair I have ever owned!!
content: When ordering this chair, all my co-workers thought I was crazy. But after getting the chair... All I can say is WOW!!!! I spend a great deal at the computer so I can be rough on my desk chairs. The hydraulic lift is solid, don't worry about any give. The adjustable arm rests can hold my full body weight leaning on them. The only thing I would improve would be I wish there was a way to lock the arm rests from rotating in and out. I think they rotate a little too easy for my comfort, but it isn't a deal breaker.

author: RR
title: Comfortable, durable, adjustable
content: This is a great chair--the same one that I have at work. The mesh is sturdy and never deteriorates. The lumbar support is easy to adjust, as is tilt, arm height, and seat height. Size B is the regular sized version. If you are tall or over 275 pounds, I recommend the larger version. It arrives preassembled. Just unscrew 4 screws using a 3/16" allen wrench, slide on the back, and put the screws back in. The whole process takes less than 5 minutes.

author: Robin K. Mcentire
title: They were like brand new!!
content: We ordered 4 Herman Miller Aeron chairs, sized C. They wanted to confirm that they received the order correctly and called me on a SUNDAY to confirm!! Very impressive. The chairs look brand new! One had a caster damaged in shipping, but I'm not going to worry about it. It works fine and it's in one of the back rooms, so no one will see it. Thank you for providing such a wonderful product at about half price!!

author: Tristanism
title: Hype
content: I guess I really don't understand the hype around Herman Miller Chairs. I bought this hoping that a more adjustable chair would help ease my chronic neck/shoulder/upper back pain. Well, it didn't help at all. Yes, it's a quality chair. But $1,000? No. I returned it as the $150 chair was just as painful to sit in as this one.

author: Beatriz
title: Good lumbar support
content: I bought this chair for my husband. He has the same chairs in his office at work. For him, the chair is very comfortable to sit on for an extended period of time. He really enjoys the lumbar support the chair offers. The lumbar support piece is adjustable depending on your comfort level, it can also be removed if you do not like. The armrests are also adjustable, either upwards/downward or inwards/outwards. So overall this chair was made for a variety of comforts.

author: Doctor
title: As good as new!
content: Arrived in excellent condition, had a hard time telling it was used. And I have a very low threshold for items with wear. After 3 months, still in great condition,  very comfortable. I was born with kyphosis and this has helped relieve the daily agony of prolonged sitting, which as I age seems to be more of an issue. Does collect 'fiber dust' under the seat after a while, but otherwise a well built product with great service and excellent packaging should last for years.

author: Galen M.
title: Best office chair ever - forget about the price and just do it.
content: I love this chair! I have had it for at least 6 months now. You forget about the price for the comfort this chair offers. I can sit in this chair working for 12 hours without feeling terribly uncomfortable like I would in a normal office chair (my last chair was a Steelcase). It was also good for me because I'm tall (6'4") and normal office chairs aren't able to offer the adjustment options that the Aeron Chair offers. I think without this chair, I would definitely have carpal tunnel by now because of how awkward other chairs were.

author: Charles T Smith Jr
title: It must be me, but...
content: The mesh seat cut across my the back of my legs.  I could not get comfortable.  Probably my bad because I tend to sit more forward toward the front edge of the chair.  The no quibble guarantee was for real.  I returned it with no problem.The chair quality was excellent.

author: Vitalii Honcharenko
title: Really cool
content: + agronomic+ nice look+ my back can't say "thank you" enough+ full mesh+ all parts adjustableIt's my second one. First chair used for 5 years - very satisfied, had to sell because of relocation.I'm using this one for a year. still look as new.

author: Philip L. Reynolds
title: An instrument of penance.
content: I am very disappointed with this chair. It's neither comfortable (it's unyielding and pokes in all the wrong places) nor orthopedic (it gives me back ache). The seat is hard, and because it's not properly contoured at the front it cuts off the circulation in my legs. An added 2-inch thick seat cushion helps with that but puts the lumbar contour in the wrong place. The lever that controls how far back the chair tilts doesn't work properly - to get the desired degree of tilt requires repeated hit and miss attempts to get close. It's very heavy, which would be worth the inconvenience if it was a comfortable and healthy chair, but it's not. The chair that it replaced, which cost less than $200, was not perfect but it was far more comfortable and healthier for my back than this one.

author: Joe Colonnello
title: Great chair.  Great company.  Highly recommended.
content: I love this chair.  I have lower back issues and I am very happy that I made an investment in this chair, as it has helped to alleviate a lot of the soreness resulting from sitting in front of a computer all day.  I also want to compliment Madison Seating.  I had to contact them after the chair was delivered and their response time was immediate.  I worked with Laila in customer service and the service/assistance she provided was exceptional.  Great chair.  Great company.  Highly recommended.

author: JNMNR
title: Comfortable Chair!
content: Amazing chair! I have a very, very bad back - I've had 4 fusion surgeries and take pain meds everyday for the pain - and this chair is wonderful! Yes, this chair is quite expensive but it is worth the money. There are so many adjustments and they enable me to set up the chair so that I finally have an office chair that fits (I'm 6' 4" and supports my back in the right places without any  hot spots.

author: Robert Brady
title: Well worth the money
content: First of all, do NOT get expert assembly on this.  Assembly is 4 screws.  It took me about 2 minutes to put it together.I was suffering from really severe shoulder pain as a programmer.  This cured it the day I started using it.  I knew my chair was the wrong height for my desk, and they I switched to this chair I was able to correct it and get the right support from the arm rests.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Arrived quickly and in good condition. It did not have the new arm ...
content: Arrived quickly and in good condition.  It did not have the new arm adjustment levers, but the older thumb screw model.  Also did not come with an instruction book.  I found something on the internet, but still figuring out the correct adjustments to make it work.

author: Surfer Shopper
title: Like New Herman Miller Aeron - nothing more to say
content: If I didn't buy this chair myself, knowing it is "used" I never would have known.  It is in absolutely "like new" condition and appearance.  I've had one just like it at my work office, so I knew what to expect and I wasn't disappointed.

author: Ed
title: The chair has made a great deal of difference in my attitude towards coming to ...
content: I spend the majority of my time in the office sitting at my desk reading and writing procedures. As a result i had developed back trouble. After only two weeks in the Herman Miller chair with the lumbar support i started feeling relief. Its been approx 4 weeks now and at least for the moment i am experiencing no issues with my back. The chair has made a great deal of difference in my attitude towards coming to work.
